It belongs to the Euphorbiaceae family and is characterized by its distinctive, palmate leaves that are often covered in a fine, white powdery coating. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that are typically yellow or greenish-yellow in color. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories. Due to its limited distribution and unique appearance, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
